Perceptor:

"Rodimus wont be very happy if we delete all her memories togehter the 
corrupted programs"hisse Perceptor"it msut exist away to do it... could we 
contain her memories and delete the programs? or insolate one and eraser it 
and then erase the other?"


----Original Message----- 
From: Super Cyclonus
Sent: Monday, November 08, 2010 11:07 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: The Awakening/nighlight

> <OLD>
>
> "Neverl will exist a program that works like that"hissed Perceptor"I tried
> do it with Nightlight and Rodimus and both remembered the emotional bond
> among them... Rodimus fully remembered and Nighlight... well she still 
> love
> him eventhoug she doesnt remember him fully... It seems that some emotions
> are hard to forget"
>
> After few seconds he said"I tought that we will wipe out her corrupted
> programs not her memories"

<NEW>

Legacy paused in his typing as he turned to face Perceptor, "A program
that would delete only the personality subroutines and yet leave the
memories intact is beyond our currently abilities to create at least
in this short period of time and with our current circumstances."

"Personality and memory are reciprocal processes in that one affects
the other." Legacy continued his single optic pulsing in a thoughtful
manner, "We are all created with standard values, some mutable and
some nearly immutable. However what we process, learn and remember
affects these values, and in turn the affect of these changes alters
how we process and learn new things in the future."

Legacy looked at Perceptor as he tilted his head, "To change one
without changing the other would be an incredibly precarious process."
Legacy paused again, obviously thinking, "It is possible that is why
you have met with only limited success. attempting to delete the
personality without a complete deletion of the underlying memories
which actually drove the personality allowed for corruption to set in
as her core matrix attempted to revive the lost bits of personality
and factional allegiance."

(TAG)

Preston
